security: Releasing Boris Dimitri Tarasoff's file number, 104 887, and the reinvestigation being pended until 1 Sept 1968, would allow outside entities to track the CIA's continued interest in the individual. Furthermore, identifying that his file has been reviewed in connection with the reinvestigation program, combined with the instruction to forward his case to the Chief, Transaction Review Section, Clearance Branch upon his return from overseas or any change in status, could reveal internal monitoring and management processes regarding CIA personnel.
summary: A form documenting the temporary suspension of reinvestigation into Boris Dimitri Tarasoff's file due to his current overseas assignment, with the case pending until September 1, 1968, and to be forwarded to the Clearance Branch upon his return or a change in status.
summary_one_paragraph: This confidential form, dated September 9, 1966, indicates that the reinvestigation of Boris Dimitri Tarasoff's file (File No. 104 887) has been suspended because he is currently assigned overseas. The case is scheduled to be revisited on September 1, 1968, or upon Tarasoff's return from his assignment, at which point it will be forwarded to the Chief of the Transaction Review Section within the Clearance Branch, as noted by the signature of M. A. Laughery.
title: TARASOFF BORIS DIMITRI REINVESTIGATION ACTION
recipient: Chief, Transaction Review Section, Clearance Branch
